info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 25 at 8:13PM MST until September 25 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southwestern Santa Cruz, mainly through Rio Rico and surrounding areas.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Rio Rico is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sonoita Creek, Penasco Canyon, Santa Cruz River, Josephine Canyon, Cedar Creek and Potrero Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nogales, Rio Rico, Patagonia Lake State Park, Tumacacori and Pena Blanca Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING
